data.enText: a large animal like a monkey , with no tail. There are different types of ape .

data.chText: 大型类人猿（如猩猩、黑猩猩）
data.enText: the great apes (= for example, orang-utans or chimpanzees )
to become extremely angry or excited
to do sth in the same way as sb else, especially when it is not done very well

data.chText: 多年来，英国电影业一味模仿好莱坞。
data.enText: For years the British film industry merely aped Hollywood.
to copy the way sb else behaves or talks, in order to make fun of them

data.chText: 我们过去常模仿老师的南方口音。
data.enText: We used to ape the teacher's southern accent.
to become extremely angry or excited

tr: any of various primates with short tails or no tail at all
person who resembles a nonhuman primate
someone who copies the words or behavior of another
represent in or produce a caricature of
imitate uncritically and in every aspect
example: Her little brother apes her behavior

value.def: Apes are chimpanzees, gorillas, and other animals in the same family.

example.ex: ...the theory that man is descended from the apes.
example.tran: 认为人类是从类人猿演变而来的理论

value.def: If you ape someone's speech or behaviour, you imitate it.

example.ex: Modelling yourself on someone you admire is not the same as aping all they say or do.
example.tran: 以偶像为榜样并不是说要模仿他们的一言一行。
只是照搬好莱坞模式的法国电影

value.def: If someone goes ape, they become very angry and upset.

example.ex: When Colonel Harper found out, he would go ape.
example.tran: 哈珀上校发现了一定会勃然大怒。
